venue.name: Alexander Stadium
venue.description: Located in Perry Barr, just outside of the city centre, the stadium will host Athletics and the Games opening and closing ceremonies.

venue.name: Arena Birmingham
venue.description: Arena Birmingham will host artistic and rhythmic gymnastics. The venue is in the middle of the city centre with excellent public transport links and close to other attractions.

venue.name: Cannock Chase Forest
venue.description: Cannock Chase is a large forest which is part of Forestry England.

venue.name: Coventry Stadium & Arena
venue.description: Judo and Wrestling will take place in the arena, which is an indoor venue. Rugby 7s will take place in the stadium, which is outdoor with some cover.

venue.name: Edgbaston Stadium
venue.description: Close to Birmingham city centre, Edgbaston Cricket Ground is a regular host of both domestic and international cricket.

venue.name: Lee Valley Velopark
venue.description: The indoor cycling center was one of the venues used for the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games.
venue.address: Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, Abercrombie Road, London, E20 3A

venue.name: The NEC
venue.description: The National Exhibition Centre (NEC) site will host a handful of different sports. Competition will happen in the NEC exhibition halls and the arena which are all indoor venues.
venue.address: North Avenue, Marston Green, Birmingham, B40 1NT
sports: Table Tennis and Para Table Tennis

venue.name: Sandwell Aquatics Centre
venue.description: The Aquatics Centre hosting swimming and diving is currently being built for the Games.

venue.name: Smithfield
venue.description: Located in the heart of Birmingham City Centre, the former Smithfield Market site will be transformed into a temporary Games venue.

venue.name: Sutton Park
venue.description: The Triathlon and Para Triathlon (for athletes with a visual impairment – PTVI) events will take place within Sutton Park and on the local roads to the south of the park, in and around Boldmere High Street. Sutton Park is a 2,400 acre National Nature Reserve located 6 miles north of the city centre. It’s one of the largest urban parks in Europe.

venue.name: University of Birmingham Hockey and Squash Centre
venue.description: At the University of Birmingham Hockey will take place on the site’s outdoor hockey pitches. We will also be hosting squash at this venue which will take place indoor in the Fitness Centre sports hall.

venue.name: Victoria Park
venue.description: Located in Leamington Spa, Victoria Park is an outdoor green recreation space with tarmac pedestrian pathways.
sports: Lawn Bowls and Para Lawn Bowls

venue.name: Victoria Square
venue.description: Victoria Square in Birmingham city centre will be the official finish area for the Marathon events which will be held on Saturday 30 July 2022.

venue.name: Warwick
venue.description: Warwick’s Myton Fields is a green recreation space, the other side of the river to St Nicholas Park that will be used for the Birmingham 2022 Road Race events.

venue.name: West Park
venue.description: West Park is an outdoor green recreation space that will host the Birmingham 2022 Cycling Time Trials.
